go_data.justification: PNGase cleaves the amide bond between the proximal N-acetylglucosamine and the linker asparagine residues on glycopeptides/glycoproteins.
PNGase releases an intact oligosaccharide and generates at the site of cleavage an aspartic acid residue in the peptide/protein backbone.
No explicit information, however, based on the provided text, it can be noted that the gene product is active in the cell and has been studied in cell extracts.
